pages.title: AI Image Upscaler
pages.metaTitle: AI Image Upscaler - Enlarge Images to 4K Without Quality Loss | MyImageUpscaler
pages.metaDescription: Upscale images up to 8x with AI. Free online tool that preserves text and logos. No watermarks. Perfect for e-commerce, print, and social media.
pages.intro: Increase image resolution up to 8x while preserving sharpness. Our AI adds realistic detail instead of just stretching pixels.
pages.description: Transform low-resolution images into high-quality visuals. Unlike traditional resizing that creates blur, our AI reconstructs detail as it upscales.

features.title: Up to 8x Upscaling
features.description: Increase image dimensions from 2x to 8x. A 500px image becomes 4000px at 8x.

features.title: Text & Logo Preservation
features.description: Trained specifically to keep text readable and logos sharp - critical for product images and documents.

features.title: Batch Processing
features.description: Process up to 50 images at once on Pro plans. Individual processing on free tier.

features.title: No Watermarks
features.description: All outputs are clean, even on the free tier. Your images, your way.

features.title: Multiple Formats
features.description: Upload JPEG, PNG, or WebP. Download in any format with quality settings.

features.title: Fast Processing
features.description: Most images process in 30-60 seconds using cloud GPU infrastructure.

useCases.title: E-commerce Product Photos
useCases.description: Meet marketplace image requirements. Amazon needs 1000x1000px minimum, eBay recommends 1600px.
useCases.example: Upscale a 400x400px supplier image to 1600x1600px for your listing.

useCases.title: Print Preparation
useCases.description: Print requires 300 DPI. An 8x10 inch print needs 2400x3000 pixels.
useCases.example: Turn a 600x750px web image into a print-ready 2400x3000px file.

useCases.title: Social Media
useCases.description: Instagram recommends 1080x1080px for posts, 1080x1920px for stories.
useCases.example: Upscale old photos before posting - they'll look sharper even after compression.

useCases.title: Website Hero Images
useCases.description: Full-width hero images need 1920px+ width for retina displays.
useCases.example: Upscale a stock photo to 3840px width for crisp display on 4K monitors.

benefits.title: Real Detail Generation
benefits.description: AI adds plausible detail rather than just interpolating pixels. Edges stay sharp, textures look natural.
benefits.metric: Neural network trained on millions of image pairs

benefits.title: Preserves What Matters
benefits.description: Text, logos, and fine details stay crisp. Most upscalers blur these elements.

benefits.title: No Technical Skills Needed
benefits.description: Upload, select scale, download. No Photoshop or technical knowledge required.

howItWorks.title: Upload Your Image
howItWorks.description: Drag and drop or click to browse. Supports JPEG, PNG, WebP up to 64MB.

howItWorks.title: Select Scale Factor
howItWorks.description: Choose 2x, 4x, or 8x. Preview shows estimated output dimensions.

howItWorks.title: Download Result
howItWorks.description: Preview your upscaled image, then download in your preferred format.

commonQuestions.question: How is this different from Photoshop's Image Size?
commonQuestions.answer: Photoshop's bicubic scaling just interpolates between pixels, creating blur. Our AI actually generates new detail based on patterns learned from millions of images. The result is sharper edges and more realistic textures.

commonQuestions.question: What's the maximum I can upscale?
commonQuestions.answer: 8x is the maximum in a single pass. You can download the 8x result and upscale again for even higher resolution, though quality may degrade with extreme enlargement.

commonQuestions.question: Will upscaling fix a blurry photo?
commonQuestions.answer: Upscaling increases resolution but won't remove existing blur. For blurry photos, use our Photo Enhancer first to sharpen, then upscale. The combination works well.

commonQuestions.question: How many images can I upscale for free?
commonQuestions.answer: 10 images per month on the free tier, with no watermarks. Paid plans start at $9/month for higher limits.

commonQuestions.question: Are my images stored on your servers?
commonQuestions.answer: Images are automatically deleted within 1 hour of processing. We don't use your images for training or share them with third parties.

faq.question: Is the AI image upscaler free?
faq.answer: Yes, 10 free credits per month with no watermarks. Each upscale uses 1 credit. Paid plans start at $9/month for more credits.

faq.question: What formats are supported?
faq.answer: Upload JPEG, PNG, or WebP. Download in any of these formats. Max file size is 64MB (5MB on free tier).

faq.question: How long does upscaling take?
faq.answer: 30-60 seconds for most images. Larger images or 8x upscaling may take slightly longer.

faq.question: Can I upscale images for commercial use?
faq.answer: Yes, you retain full rights to your upscaled images. Use them for any purpose - personal, commercial, print, or web.

pages.title: AI Photo Enhancer
pages.metaTitle: AI Photo Enhancer - Fix Blurry Photos, Restore Old Images | MyImageUpscaler
pages.metaDescription: Enhance photo quality with AI. Fix blur, improve colors, reduce noise, restore old photos. Free online tool with natural-looking results.
pages.intro: Improve photo quality without changing dimensions. Fix blur, enhance colors, reduce noise, and restore old or damaged photos.
pages.description: Improve photo quality while keeping the same resolution. Ideal for fixing issues before upscaling, or when you just need better quality at the current size.

features.title: Deblur & Sharpen
features.description: Reduce motion blur and soft focus. Works best on moderately blurry images - severe blur has physical limits.

features.title: Noise Reduction
features.description: Remove grain from low-light or high-ISO photos while preserving detail.

features.title: Color Correction
features.description: Auto-adjust white balance, exposure, and contrast. Fix color casts from indoor lighting.

features.title: Face Enhancement
features.description: Automatically detect and enhance faces with appropriate skin tone handling.

features.title: Old Photo Restoration
features.description: Reduce scratches, fix fading, and restore color to vintage photos.

features.title: Before/After Preview
features.description: Compare original and enhanced versions side-by-side before downloading.

useCases.title: Old Photo Restoration
useCases.description: Restore scanned family photos from the 60s-90s. Fix fading, scratches, and color shifts.
useCases.example: Restore grandparents' wedding photo for an anniversary gift.

useCases.title: Low-Light Photo Fixes
useCases.description: Reduce noise from phone photos taken in dim restaurants or evening events.
useCases.example: Clean up grainy party photos from your phone's night mode.

useCases.title: Portrait Improvement
useCases.description: Enhance portraits with face detection for natural skin tones and sharpness.
useCases.example: Improve a LinkedIn headshot taken with a phone camera.

useCases.title: Pre-Upscaling Preparation
useCases.description: Enhance quality before upscaling for best results. Fix issues at original size first.
useCases.example: Sharpen a blurry photo, then upscale it 4x for printing.

benefits.title: Natural Results
benefits.description: Avoids the over-processed 'HDR look'. Enhancements look like a better camera, not a filter.

benefits.title: Automatic Detection
benefits.description: AI identifies what's wrong - blur, noise, color issues - and applies appropriate fixes.

benefits.title: Preserves Character
benefits.description: Old photos keep their vintage feel. We reduce damage, not character.

howItWorks.title: Upload Your Photo
howItWorks.description: Drag and drop or browse. Works with photos from any era or source.

howItWorks.title: AI Analysis
howItWorks.description: Our AI scans for blur, noise, color issues, and damage. Different issues get different treatments.

howItWorks.title: Review & Download
howItWorks.description: Use the before/after slider to compare, then download your enhanced photo.

commonQuestions.question: Can you fix severely blurry photos?
commonQuestions.answer: We can significantly improve moderately blurry photos. Severe blur (like strong motion blur or completely out of focus) has physical limits - the original detail simply wasn't captured. You'll see improvement, but don't expect perfection.

commonQuestions.question: What's the difference between this and the upscaler?
commonQuestions.answer: The Photo Enhancer improves quality at the same resolution (sharpening, color, noise). The Upscaler increases dimensions. For best results on low-quality images: enhance first, then upscale.

commonQuestions.question: Will my enhanced photos look over-processed?
commonQuestions.answer: No. We specifically train to avoid the artificial 'HDR look' or over-sharpened appearance. Results look like a better camera was used, not like a filter was applied.

commonQuestions.question: Can you restore very old or damaged photos?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes, though results vary with damage severity. We can reduce (not eliminate) scratches, fix fading, and restore color. Severe damage like torn sections can't be reconstructed.

commonQuestions.question: Does enhancement work on screenshots?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes, particularly for text clarity and noise reduction. For screenshots with text, this tool can improve readability.

faq.question: Is the photo enhancer free?
faq.answer: Yes, 10 free enhancements per month with no watermarks. Paid plans offer more credits.

faq.question: What types of photos work best?
faq.answer: Photos with moderate issues see the best improvement. Slightly blurry, noisy, or faded photos enhance well. Severely damaged photos will improve but have limits.

faq.question: Can I enhance and upscale together?
faq.answer: Yes, but run them separately for best results. Enhance first to fix quality issues, then upscale the enhanced image.

faq.question: Does this work on phone photos?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Phone photos often have noise from small sensors and can benefit significantly from enhancement.
